titles: William by the grace of God, King of Great-Britain, France, and Ireland, Defender of the faith ... forasmuch as the lords of our Privy Council, by their act of the day and date hereof have appointed their clerks to raise and give out letters ... against all sheriffs of shires, magistrats of burghs, and others, who ... are appointed to sease the saids horses and arms ...
author: Scotland. Privy Council.
Scotland. Sovereign (1694-1702 : William II)
publisher: Printed by the heir of Andrew Anderson, Printer to his most excellent Majesty,
notes: Title from opening lines of text.
Royal arms at head of text; initial letter.
Blank spaces in text filled in ms.; illegible.
Dated: Given under Our Signet at Edinburgh, the sixteenth day of April, and of Our Reign the eight year, 1696.
Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland.
keywords: Loyalty oaths --  Scotland --  Early works to 1800.
National security --  Law and legislation --  Scotland --  Early works to 1800.
